Document.ChangesMsg1: Added the announced dedication dates for the Concepcion Chile and Barranquilla Colombia temples.
Document.ChangesMsg2: Updated construction status for Oklahoma City Oklahoma, Lisbon Portugal, Mesa Arizona, Barranquilla Colombia, Concepcion Chile, Raleigh North Carolina, Rio de Janeiro Brazil and Kinshasa DR Congo temples.
Document.ChangesMsg3: Check out the new FAQ page available from the Home tab's Info page.

Place.name: Aaronic Priesthood Restoration Area
Place.Snippet: In a place near this path, John the Baptist appeared to Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery. He restored the Aaronic Priesthood and conferred priesthood authority on Joseph and Oliver.

Place.name: Aba Nigeria Temple
Place.Snippet: 121st operating temple - Dedicated 7 August 2005 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 2 April 2000)
Place.Address: Okpu-Umuoba Road, Off Aba-Owerri Road at Union Bank

Place.name: Abidjan Ivory Coast Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 5, 2015 - Status: Planning and approval; awaiting official site announcement

Place.name: Accra Ghana Temple
Place.Snippet: 117th operating temple - Dedicated 11 January 2004 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 16 February 1998)
Place.Address: 57 Independence Avenue, North Ridge, PMB CT 209

Place.name: Adam-ondi-Ahman
Place.Snippet: Where Adam and Eve lived after being expelled from the Garden of Eden. Before his death, Adam called his righteous posterity into this valley and bestowed on them his last blessing.

Place.name: Adelaide Australia Temple
Place.Snippet: 89th operating temple - Dedicated 15 June 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 17 March 1999)

Place.name: Albuquerque New Mexico Temple
Place.Snippet: 73rd operating temple - Dedicated 5 March 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 4 April 1997)

Place.name: Anchorage Alaska Temple
Place.Snippet: 54th operating temple - Dedicated 9–10 January 1999 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 4 October 1997); Rededicated 8 February 2004 by Gordon B. Hinckley

Place.name: Apia Samoa Temple
Place.Snippet: 22nd operating temple - Dedicated 5–6 August 1983 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 15 October 1977); Rededicated 4 September 2005 by Gordon B. Hinckley

Place.name: Arequipa Peru Temple
Place.Snippet: Scheduled Dedication: early 2020 (Announced 6 October 2012) - Status: Cladding exterior in granite over vapor barrier; pouring curbing and surface parking

Place.name: Assembly Hall
Place.Snippet: A charming Gothic-style building with lovely stained-glass windows. This jewel of a building was constructed between 1877 and 1882.

Place.name: Asunción Paraguay Temple
Place.Snippet: 112th operating temple - Dedicated 19 May 2002 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 2 April 2000); CLOSED: Renovation commenced in October 2017 - Status: building permits secured

Place.name: Atlanta Georgia Temple
Place.Snippet: 21st operating temple - Dedicated 1–4 June 1983 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 2 April 1980); Rededicated 14 November 1997 by Gordon B. Hinckley (baptistry only) and 1 May 2011 by Thomas S. Monson

Place.name: Bangkok Thailand Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 5, 2015 - Status: Official temple rendering released; site location announced

Place.name: Barranquilla Colombia Temple
Place.Snippet: Scheduled Dedication: 9 December 2018 (Announced 1 October 2011) - Status: Work appears completed on the exterior and grounds; interior progressing

Place.name: Baton Rouge Louisiana Temple
Place.Snippet: 94th operating temple - Dedicated 16 July 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 14 October 1998); CLOSED: Renovation commenced in February 2018 - Status: Exterior walls framed in showing new shape of redesign.

Place.name: Beehive House
Place.Snippet: Built in 1854, it was home to Brigham Young and other Church leaders, and also served as offices for the Church for many years.

Place.name: Belem Brazil Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 3, 2016 - Status: Planning and approval; awaiting official site announcement

Place.name: Bengaluru India Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 1, 2018 - Status: Planning and approval; awaiting official site announcement

Place.name: Bern Switzerland Temple
Place.Snippet: 9th operating temple - 11–15 September 1955 by David O. McKay (Announced 1 July 1952); Rededicated 23–25 October 1992 by Gordon B. Hinckley

Place.name: Billings Montana Temple
Place.Snippet: 66th operating temple - Dedicated 20–21 November 1999 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 30 August 1996)

Place.name: Birmingham Alabama Temple
Place.Snippet: 98th operating temple - Dedicated 3 September 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 11 September 1998)

Place.name: Bismarck North Dakota Temple
Place.Snippet: 61st operating temple - Dedicated 19 September 1999 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 29 July 1998)

Place.name: Bluff Fort
Place.Snippet: Through the efforts of the Hole-in-the-Rock Foundation, this marvelous recreation has been constructed as a monument to the original settlement founded by faithful Mormon stalwarts called to the area in 1880.

Place.name: Bogotá Colombia Temple
Place.Snippet: 57th operating temple - Dedicated 24–26 April 1999 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 7 April 1984)

Place.name: Boise Idaho Temple
Place.Snippet: 27th operating temple - Dedicated 25–30 May 1984 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 31 March 1982); Rededicated 29 May 1987 by James E. Faust (addition only) and 18 November 2012 by Thomas S. Monson

Place.name: Boston Massachusetts Temple
Place.Snippet: 100th operating temple - Dedicated 1 October 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 30 September 1995 )

Place.name: Bountiful Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: 47th operating temple - Dedicated 8–14 January 1995 by Howard W. Hunter (Announced 2 February 1990)

Place.name: Box Elder Tabernacle
Place.Snippet: On a site selected by Brigham Young in 1865, this impressive building was finally completed and dedicated by Wilford Woodruff on October 26, 1890. A major restoration was completed in 1987 and dedicated by Boyd K. Packer on April 12.

Place.name: Brasília Brazil Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 2, 2017 - Status: Planning and approval; site inspected by Church engineers on June 21, 2017

Place.name: Brigham City Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: 139th operating temple - Dedicated 23 September 2012 by Boyd K. Packer (Announced 3 October 2009)

Place.name: Brigham Young Birthplace Monument
Place.Snippet: This impressive stone monument was erected in 1950 with President George Albert Smith performing the dedication.

Place.name: Brigham Young Nauvoo Home
Place.Snippet: Completed by Brigham Young in May, 1843. Prayer meetings of the Quorum of the Twelve were held in the home and ordinances were performed here as well.

Place.name: Brigham Young Winter Home
Place.Snippet: President Brigham Young spent the last winters of his life in the St. George area enjoying the warm weather and directing the building of the St. George Temple and Tabernacle.

Place.name: Brisbane Australia Temple
Place.Snippet: 115th operating temple - Dedicated 15 June 2003 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 20 July 1998)

Place.name: Buenos Aires Argentina Temple
Place.Snippet: 39th operating temple - Dedicated 17–19 January 1986 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 2 April 1980); Rededicated 9 September 2012 by Henry B. Eyring

Place.name: BYU Jerusalem Center
Place.Snippet: A beautiful center for study in Jerusalem overlooking the Mount of Olives, the Kidron Valley, and the Old City. The 125,000-square-foot, eight-level structure is set amid five acres of beautifully landscaped gardens.

Place.name: Cagayan de Oro Philippines Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 1, 2018 - Status: Planning and approval; awaiting official site announcement

Place.name: Calgary Alberta Temple
Place.Snippet: 140th operating temple - Dedicated 28 October 2012 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 4 October 2008)

Place.name: Campinas Brazil Temple
Place.Snippet: 111th operating temple - Dedicated 17 May 2002 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 3 April 1997)
Place.Address: Rua James Esdras Faust, 400, Notre Dame

Place.name: Caracas Venezuela Temple
Place.Snippet: 96th operating temple - Dedicated 20 August 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 30 September 1995)
Place.Address: Avenida C con Calle C-1, Urbanización Caurimare

Place.name: Cardston Alberta Temple
Place.Snippet: 6th operating temple - Dedicated 26–29 August 1923 by Heber J. Grant (Announced 27 June 1913); Rededicated 2 July 1962 by Hugh B. Brown (addition only) and 22–24 June 1991 by Gordon B. Hinckley

Place.name: Carthage Jail
Place.Snippet: To commemorate the sesquicentennial of the Martyrdom in 1994, the jail was restored to its appearance at the time of Joseph and Hyrum's death.

Place.name: Cebu City Philippines Temple
Place.Snippet: 133rd operating temple - Dedicated 13 June 2010 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 18 April 2006)

Place.name: Cedar City Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: 159th operating temple - Dedicated 10 December 2017 by Henry B. Eyring (Announced 6 April 2013)

Place.name: Chicago Illinois Temple
Place.Snippet: 35th operating temple - Dedicated 9–13 August 1985 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 1 April 1981); Rededicated 8 October 1989 by Gordon B. Hinckley (addition only)

Place.name: Church History Library
Place.Snippet: Completed in 2009, this building contains materials that chronicle the history of the Church from 1830 down to the present day. Many of these materials are available for you to explore.

Place.name: Church History Museum
Place.Snippet: The story of the church told through educational exhibits and programs. Founded in 1984.

Place.name: Church Office Building
Place.Snippet: Worldwide headquarters of the Church. Check out the 26th floor observation deck where you can take in spectacular views of Temple Square, the Wasatch Mountains, and the Salt Lake Valley.

Place.name: Ciudad Juárez Mexico Temple
Place.Snippet: 71st operating temple - Dedicated 26–27 February 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 7 May 1998)
Place.Address: Calle Paraguay #290, Esquina José Borunda, Colonia Partido Romero

Place.name: Cochabamba Bolivia Temple
Place.Snippet: 82nd operating temple - Dedicated 30 April 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 13 January 1995)

Place.name: Cody Murals Chapel
Place.Snippet: The magnificent mural covers a domed ceiling 36 feet in diameter and 18 feet to the top of the dome. It includes selected historical scenes from the first 70 years of The Church

Place.name: Colonia Juárez Chihuahua Mexico Temple
Place.Snippet: 55th operating temple - Dedicated 6–7 March 1999 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 4 October 1997)

Place.name: Columbia River Washington Temple
Place.Snippet: 107th operating temple - Dedicated 18 November 2001 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 2 April 2000)

Place.name: Columbia South Carolina Temple
Place.Snippet: 62nd operating temple - Dedicated 16–17 October 1999 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 11 September 1998)

Place.name: Columbus Ohio Temple
Place.Snippet: 60th operating temple - Dedicated 4–5 September 1999 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 25 April 1998)

Place.name: Concepción Chile Temple
Place.Snippet: Scheduled Dedication: 28 October 2018 (Announced 3 October 2009) - Status: Preparing for the public open house that begins September 15th.

Place.name: Conference Center
Place.Snippet: Step inside the largest auditorium of its kind in the world! The building also houses a number of original paintings including the famous Book of Mormon gallery by Arnold Friberg. Tours of the roof gardens are offered April through October.

Place.name: Copenhagen Denmark Temple
Place.Snippet: 118th operating temple - Dedicated 23 May 2004 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 17 March 1999)

Place.name: Córdoba Argentina Temple
Place.Snippet: 145th operating temple - Dedicated 17 May 2015 by Dieter F. Uchtdorf (Announced 4 October 2008)

Place.name: Cove Fort Historic Site
Place.Snippet: Built in 1867, it was constructed as a safe stop for travelers, where they could find shelter, fresh water, and feed for livestock. It stands as a representation of faith, dedication and pioneer resourcefulness.

Place.name: Curitiba Brazil Temple
Place.Snippet: 126th operating temple - Dedicated 1 June 2008 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 23 August 2002)

Place.name: Dallas Texas Temple
Place.Snippet: 30th operating temple - Dedicated 19–24 October 1984 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 1 April 1981); Rededicated 5 March 1989 by Gordon B. Hinckley (addition only)

Place.name: Daughters of the Utah Pioneers Museum
Place.Snippet: Enjoy pioneer-era artifacts and celebrate the achievements of the men, women, and children who founded Utah.

Place.name: David Whitmer Grave
Place.Snippet: One of the Witnesses of the Book of Mormon. his grave is located 21 feet from the rear boundary of the Richmond Cemetery and 33 feet east of the Middle Cemetery Road.

Place.name: Denver Colorado Temple
Place.Snippet: 40th operating temple - Dedicated 24–28 October 1986 by Ezra Taft Benson (Announced 31 March 1982)

Place.name: Detroit Michigan Temple
Place.Snippet: 63rd operating temple - Dedicated 23–24 October 1999 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 10 August 1998)

Place.name: Deuel Log Home
Place.Snippet: Built in 1847 by saints from one of the first pioneer companies to the valley, it is one of the oldest structures still intact in Salt Lake City. Originally built in what is now Pioneer Park, it was restored in its current location in 1985.

Place.name: Draper Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: 129th operating temple - Dedicated 20–22 March 2009 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 2 October 2004)

Place.name: Durban South Africa Temple
Place.Snippet: Scheduled Dedication: late 2018 (Announced 1 October 2011) - Status: Finishing work on the roofing and walls continues. Air-conditioning, electrical, elevator, data and fire work continues. Dry-walling, finishing, sanding, painting and millwork continues.

Place.name: Edmonton Alberta Temple
Place.Snippet: 67th operating temple - Dedicated 11–12 December 1999 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 11 August 1998)

Place.name: Eight Witnesses Monument
Place.Snippet: The impressive granite monument stands majestically near the graves of Christian and Peter Whitmer.

Place.name: Ensign Peak
Place.Snippet: Two days after entering the Salt Lake Valley, Brigham Young and several other Church leaders unfurled here “an ‘ensign’ of liberty to the world.”

Place.name: Fairport Harbor Monument
Place.Snippet: An historic plaque near this marine musuem pays tribute to the more than 3,000 Saints who passed through here as they were coming to and leaving Kirtland, Ohio.

Place.name: Family History Library
Place.Snippet: This is the largest library of its kind with data for over 3 billion deceased ancestors from around the globe. Fun and engaging interactive discovery experiences for the whole family on the Main Floor.

Place.name: Far West
Place.Snippet: Cornerstones for a temple were laid here in July 1838 in this early LDS Missouri settlement. The Saints were driven from the area before work could proceed further.

Place.name: Fort Collins Colorado Temple
Place.Snippet: 153rd operating temple - Dedicated 16 October 2016 by Dieter F. Uchtdorf (Announced 2 April 2011)

Place.name: Fort Lauderdale Florida Temple
Place.Snippet: 143rd operating temple - Dedicated 4 May 2014 by Dieter F. Uchtdorf (Announced 3 October 2009)

Place.name: Fortaleza Brazil Temple
Place.Snippet: Scheduled Dedication: early 2019 (Announced 3 October 2009) - Status: Art glass being installed and tower being finished.
Place.Address: Avenida Santos Dumont esq Rua Mal. Mascarenhas Morais

Place.name: Frankfurt Germany Temple
Place.Snippet: 41st operating temple - Dedicated 28–30 August 1987 by Ezra Taft Benson (Announced 1 April 1981); Closed for renovation until mid 2018 - Status: reattaching cladding to exterior; Renovation of Temple complex nearing completion.

Place.name: Freiberg Germany Temple
Place.Snippet: 33rd operating temple - Dedicated 29–30 June 1985 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 9 October 1982); Rededicated 7 September 2002 by Gordon B. Hinckley and 4 September 2016 by Dieter F. Uchtdorf

Place.name: Fresno California Temple
Place.Snippet: 78th operating temple - Dedicated 9 April 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 8 January 1999)

Place.name: Fukuoka Japan Temple
Place.Snippet: 88th operating temple - Dedicated 11 June 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 7 May 1998)

Place.name: Gadfield Elm Chapel
Place.Snippet: Originally built as a meeting place for the members of the United Brethren congregation who deeded it to the Church after they all converted. In 1840, Brigham Young preached here which, at the time, was the only Latter-day Saint chapel in the world.

Place.name: Garden Grove
Place.Snippet: The first temporary way station established in Iowa near the Weldon Fork of the Grand River on April 24, 1846. Many of the Saints’ lives were spared during the harsh first winter thanks to the kindness of their non-Mormon neighbors.

Place.name: Garden Tomb
Place.Snippet: President Harold B. Lee gave special emphasis to the significance of the site. "Something seemed to impress us as we stood there," he said, "that this was the holiest place of all, and we fancied we could have witnessed the dramatic scene that took place there."

Place.name: Gethsemane
Place.Snippet: The likely place where Jesus prayed and suffered for the sins of mankind. In Aramaic, it means 'olive press.' Oil is still pressed from the fruit of eight ancient and gnarled olive trees that give the garden a timeless character.

Place.name: Grandin Building
Place.Snippet: Book of Mormon Publication Site located in the business district of historic Palmyra, New York.

Place.name: Greater Manila Philippines Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 2, 2017- Status: Planning and approval; awaiting official name announcement; Elder Ronald A. Rasband visited this temple site during a recent countrywide tour.

Place.name: Gilbert Arizona Temple
Place.Snippet: 142nd operating temple - Dedicated 2 March 2014 by Thomas S. Monson read by Henry B. Eyring (Announced 26 April 2008)

Place.name: Guadalajara Mexico Temple
Place.Snippet: 105th operating temple - Dedicated 29 April 2001 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 14 April 1999)
Place.Address: Avenida Patria no. 879, Fraccionamiento Jardines Tepeyac

Place.name: Guatemala City Guatemala Temple
Place.Snippet: 32nd operating temple - Dedicated 14–16 December 1984 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 1 April 1981)

Place.name: Guayaquil Ecuador Temple
Place.Snippet: 58th operating temple - Dedicated 1–2 August 1999 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 31 March 1982)
Place.Address: Calle 6ta y Avenida Rodrigo Chávez González, Principado de las Lomas

Place.name: Halifax Nova Scotia Temple
Place.Snippet: 64th operating temple - Dedicated 14 November 1999 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 7 May 1998)

Place.name: Hamilton New Zealand Temple
Place.Snippet: 11th operating temple - Dedicated 20–22 April 1958 by David O. McKay (Announced 17 February 1955); CLOSED: Renovation Commenced in July 2018

Place.name: Harare Zimbabwe Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 3, 2016 - Status: Planning and approval; official site announcement anticipated in 2017

Place.name: Hartford Connecticut Temple
Place.Snippet: 155th operating temple - Dedicated 20 November 2016 by Henry B. Eyring (Announced 2 October 2010)

Place.name: Haun's Mill
Place.Snippet: Early latter-day saint settlement on Shoal Creek. Site of the most savage massacre that occurred during the Missouri troubles.

Place.name: Heber C. Kimball Nauvoo Home
Place.Snippet: The brick home that the family occupied less than a year before they were forced to leave and faithfully gathered with the Saints for the westward trek.

Place.name: Helsinki Finland Temple
Place.Snippet: 124th operating temple - Dedicated 22 October 2006 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 2 April 2000)

Place.name: Hermosillo Sonora Mexico Temple
Place.Snippet: 72nd operating temple - Dedicated 27 February 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 20 July 1998)
Place.Address: General Pedro García Conde no. 303, Esquina Con Juan José Ríos, Colonia Pitic

Place.name: Hill Cumorah
Place.Snippet: The golden plates were buried here by Moroni. A granite monument topped by a nine-foot statue of Moroni was erected at the highest point of the hill in 1935.

Place.name: Hill Cumorah Visitors' Center
Place.Snippet: Learn about the events that occurred on and near the Hill Cumorah in the 1820s.

Place.name: Hill Farm and Benbow's Pond
Place.Snippet: At this site on March 6th, 1840, Wilford Woodruff baptized the first of the 600 converts from the United Brethren's congregation and 45 additional converts were baptized through 1841. A marker was erected in 1987 to commemorate the sesquicentennial of the Church in the British Isles.

Place.name: Hong Kong China Temple
Place.Snippet: 48th operating temple - Dedicated 26–27 May 1996 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 3 October 1992)

Place.name: Houston Texas Temple
Place.Snippet: 97th operating temple - Dedicated 26–27 August 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 30 September 1997); Rededicated 22 April 2018 by M. Russell Ballard

Place.name: Hyde Park Chapel
Place.Snippet: This functioning chapel was recently remodeled to include a variety of exhibits on principles of the gospel of Jesus Christ, temples, and the history of The Church in the British Isles.

Place.name: Icelandic Monument
Place.Snippet: Dedicated In 1938, this replica of a lighthouse commemorates the first permanent settlement in the United States of this people. Includes a viking ship on top with the 16 original immigrants’ names etched into the monument

Place.name: Idaho Falls Idaho Temple
Place.Snippet: 8th operating temple - Dedicated 23–25 September 1945 by George Albert Smith (Announced 3 March 1937); Rededicated 4 June 2017 by Henry B. Eyring

Place.name: Idaho Falls Temple Visitors' Center
Place.Snippet: Enjoy the reflection of the Idaho Falls Idaho Temple in the nearby Snake River.

Place.name: Independence Visitors' Center
Place.Snippet: A discovery of Church sites in Missouri begins at the Independence Visitors' Center.

Place.name: Indianapolis Indiana Temple
Place.Snippet: 148th operating temple - Dedicated 23 August 2015 by Henry B. Eyring (Announced 2 October 2010)

Place.name: Isaac and Elizabeth Hale Home
Place.Snippet: This reconstructed home, built at its original location, offers a glimpse into Emma’s life as a child and as a young woman. You will also see the place where Joseph began translating the Book of Mormon.

Place.name: Isaac Morley Farm
Place.Snippet: Served as the principle gathering place of the Saints in Kirtland after the revelation for the Saints to gather to Ohio.

Place.name: Jacob Hamblin Home
Place.Snippet: Home of the man who was called "Friend of the Indians." See what life was like for a large family in a frontier town.

Place.name: Johannesburg South Africa Temple
Place.Snippet: 36th operating temple - Dedicated 24–25 August 1985 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 1 April 1981)

Place.name: Jonathan Browning Nauvoo Home and Gun Shop
Place.Snippet: Learn about the humble beginnings of the worldwide Browning Arms Corporation. See authentic rifles, handguns, and shotguns from the early 1800s.

Place.name: John Johnson Home
Place.Snippet: During the year Joseph Smith stayed here, this home served as headquarters of the Church and he received an outpouring of revelation within these walls. Several conferences were also held here.

Place.name: John Taylor Nauvoo Home
Place.Snippet: One of the earliest brick homes in Nauvoo. This beautiful federal-style home was built by John Ivins and later occupied by a future prophet and his family.

Place.name: Johnson Inn Resource Center
Place.Snippet: Gain a wealth of information about the Kirtland area by visiting this reconstruction with exhibits that serve as a reminder of the rich heritage of Kirtland.

Place.name: Jordan River Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: 20th operating temple - Dedicated 16–20 November 1981 by Marion G. Romney (Announced 3 February 1978); Rededicated 20 May 2018 by Henry B. Eyring

Place.name: Joseph and Emma Smith Susquehanna Home
Place.Snippet: Reconstructed at its original location, this home is where Emma gave birth to her first child. Joseph translated most of the Book of Mormon here, with Oliver Cowdery and others acting as scribes.

Place.name: Joseph Smith Birthplace Memorial
Place.Snippet: The smooth polished obelisk shaft is 38 1/2 feet tall, one foot for each year of the Prophet's life. A visitor's center provides further information.

Place.name: Joseph Smith Historic Site
Place.Snippet: Guided walking tours begin at this Visitors Center; start with a short film and continue through the Smith family’s homes. Operated by the Community of Christ.

Place.name: Joseph Smith Memorial Building
Place.Snippet: Formerly the Hotel Utah, was built in 1911. Completely renovated and reopened in 1993, now houses the Legacy Theater, a FamilySearch center and restaurants.

Place.name: Kanesville Tabernacle
Place.Snippet: Now serves as a visitors' center, where you can learn more about the epic history of the Latter-day Saints' migration westward.

Place.name: Kansas City Missouri Temple
Place.Snippet: 137th operating temple - Dedicated 6 May 2012 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 4 October 2008)

Place.name: Kinshasa Democratic Republic of the Congo Temple
Place.Snippet: Scheduled Dedication: late 2018 (Announced 1 October 2011) - Status: Exterior is nearing completion. Beautiful walkways being installed on grounds.

Place.name: Kirtland Ashery
Place.Snippet: Gain insight into this unique industry in providing the financial means to build the temple and other Church buildings.

Place.name: Kirtland Temple
Place.Snippet: The first temple erected in this dispensation. The design for this holy edifice was received by detailed revelation to the Prophet Joseph Smith and others.

Place.name: Kirtland Sawmill
Place.Snippet: This reconstructed building demonstrates how timber was cut in the 1830s. This mill cut much of the timber for the woodwork in the Kirtland Temple.

Place.name: Kirtland Schoolhouse
Place.Snippet: Replica of the original built on this spot in 1819. This was a center of activity and, on Sundays, the Saints often met here for Church meetings.

Place.name: Kirtland Visitors' Center
Place.Snippet: Historic Kirtland, a small settlement in northern Ohio where members gathered shortly after the Church was founded.

Place.name: Kona Hawaii Temple
Place.Snippet: 70th operating temple - Dedicated 23–24 January 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 7 May 1998)

Place.name: Kyiv Ukraine Temple
Place.Snippet: 134th operating temple - Dedicated 29 August 2010 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 20 July 1998)

Place.name: Laie Hawaii Temple
Place.Snippet: 5th operating temple - Dedicated 27–30 November 1919 by Heber J. Grant (Announced 3 October 1915); Rededicated 13–15 June 1978 by Spencer W. Kimball and 21 November 2010 by Thomas S. Monson

Place.name: Laie Hawaii Temple Visitors' Center
Place.Snippet: Enjoy the lush gardens on the Laie Hawaii Temple grounds, then come inside the visitors' center to learn more about Jesus Christ and the purpose of temples.

Place.name: Layton Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 1, 2018 - Status: Planning and approval; awaiting official site announcement

Place.name: Las Vegas Nevada Temple
Place.Snippet: 43rd operating temple - Dedicated 16–18 December 1989 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 7 April 1984)

Place.name: Layton Utah FamilySearch Center
Place.Snippet: Opened in November 2016, this remarkable state-of-the-art facility is designed to personalize the family history experience for all ages.

Place.name: Lehi Utah FamilySearch Center
Place.Snippet: The newly opened center is located just south of the Thanksgiving Point Golf Course Clubhouse. In addition to research assistance and other services, this new facility is equipped with an exciting Discovery Center.

Place.name: Liberty Jail
Place.Snippet: Where the Prophet Joseph Smith spent approximately five months awaiting trial. While there he received three significant revelations.

Place.name: Lima Peru Temple
Place.Snippet: 38th operating temple - Dedicated 10–12 January 1986 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 1 April 1981)
Place.Address: Calle Saint Tropez N° 140, Urb. La Riviera de Monterrico

Place.name: Lima Peru Los Olivos Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 3, 2016 - Status: Planning and approval; awaiting official site announcement

Place.name: Lion House
Place.Snippet: Built in 1856 by Brigham Young, the home derives its name from the stone statue resting over the front entrance. It is now a restaurant.

Place.name: Lisbon Portugal Temple
Place.Snippet: Scheduled Dedication: late 2019 (Announced 2 October 2010) - Status: Stone cladding making progress; Beautiful white exterior of the new meetinghouse next to the temple now visible.

Place.name: Logan Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: 2nd operating temple - Dedicated 17–19 May 1884 by John Taylor (Announced 6 October 1876); Rededicated 13–15 March 1979 by Spencer W. Kimball

Place.name: Logan Tabernacle
Place.Snippet: Completed and dedicated in 1891 by Wilford Woodruff, it took 27 years to complete. A four-year-long restoration project was completed in 1989. It is the site of many local celebrations, including the city's annual Summerfest Arts Faire.

Place.name: London England Temple
Place.Snippet: 12th operating temple - Dedicated 7–9 September 1958 by David O. McKay (Announced 10 August 1953); Rededicated 18–20 October 1992 by Gordon B. Hinckley

Place.name: Los Angeles California Temple
Place.Snippet: 10th operating temple - Dedicated 11–14 March 1956 by David O. McKay (Announced 6 March 1937)

Place.name: Los Angeles Temple Visitors' Center
Place.Snippet: This beautiful center is a peaceful place that complements the sacredness of the temple.

Place.name: Louisville Kentucky Temple
Place.Snippet: 76th operating temple - Dedicated 19 March 2000 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 17 March 1999)

Place.name: Lubbock Texas Temple
Place.Snippet: 109th operating temple - Dedicated 21 April 2002 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 2 April 2000)

Place.name: Lucy Mack Smith Nauvoo Home
Place.Snippet: Home of the prophet's mother. Joseph Bates Noble, a justice of the peace in Nauvoo, built the home, stable, carriage house, and other outbuildings.

Place.name: Lyon Drug Store
Place.Snippet: Browse the shelves and discover the inventory of an 1840 period business establishment, including medicines, textiles, hardware, and household items.

Place.name: Madrid Spain Temple
Place.Snippet: 56th operating temple - Dedicated 19–21 March 1999 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 4 April 1993)

Place.name: Managua Nicaragua Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 1, 2018 - Status: Planning and approval; awaiting official site announcement

Place.name: Manaus Brazil Temple
Place.Snippet: 138th operating temple - Dedicated 10 June 2012 by Dieter F. Uchtdorf (Announced 23 May 2007)

Place.name: Manhattan New York Temple
Place.Snippet: 119th operating temple - Dedicated 13 June 2004 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 7 August 2002)

Place.name: Manila Philippines Temple
Place.Snippet: 29th operating temple - Dedicated 25–27 September 1984 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 1 April 1981)

Place.name: Mansion House - Nauvoo
Place.Snippet: In 1842 Joseph built this fine frame house. This final home for Joseph and Emma gave them space to raise their children, meet with guests, and provide rooms for visitors.

Place.name: Manti Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: 3rd operating temple - Dedicated 21–23 May 1888 by Lorenzo Snow (Announced 25 June 1875); Rededicated 14–16 June 1985 by Gordon B. Hinckley

Place.name: Matthew Cowley Pacific Church History Centre
Place.Snippet: Includes a library, with its environmentally controlled archival storage room, public reading room, and a 400 square-meter museum.

Place.name: McKune Cemetery
Place.Snippet: Joseph and Emma buried their firstborn child, a son, near other Hale family graves in this cemetery.

Place.name: Medford Oregon Temple
Place.Snippet: 79th operating temple - Dedicated 16 April 2000 by James E. Faust (Announced 15 March 1999)

Place.name: Melbourne Australia Temple
Place.Snippet: 90th operating temple - Dedicated 16 June 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 30 October 1998)

Place.name: Memphis Tennessee Temple
Place.Snippet: 80th operating temple - Dedicated 23 April 2000 by James E. Faust (Announced 17 September 1998); CLOSED: Renovation commenced in October 2017 - Status: Cladding the steeple and exterior walls with beautiful Portuguese Limestone.

Place.name: Mérida Mexico Temple
Place.Snippet: 92nd operating temple - Dedicated 8 July 2000 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 25 September 1998)
Place.Address: Calle 70 no. 527 Esquina 65 y 67, Colonia Centro

Place.name: Meridian Idaho Temple
Place.Snippet: 158th operating temple - Dedicated 19 November 2017 by Dieter F. Uchtdorf (Announced 2 April 2011)

Place.name: Mesa Arizona Temple
Place.Snippet: 7th operating temple - Dedicated 23–26 October 1927 by Heber J. Grant (Announced 3 October 1919); Rededicated 15–16 April 1975 by Spencer W. Kimball; CLOSED: Renovation commenced May 2018 - Status: Majority of landscaping removed from site.

Place.name: Mesa Arizona Temple Visitors' Center
Place.Snippet: CLOSED: Relocation commenced May 2018 - Status: Demolishing and relocating to a new 18,000 square foot visitors’ center and interactive Family History Discovery Center on the corner of Main and LeSueur

Place.name: Mexico City Mexico Temple
Place.Snippet: 26th operating temple - Dedicated 2–4 December 1983 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 3 April 1976); Rededicated 16 November 2008 by Thomas S. Monson and 13 September 2015 by Henry B. Eyring
Place.Address: Avenida 510 no. 90, Colonia San Juan de Aragón

Place.name: Mexico City Mexico Temple Visitors' Center
Place.Snippet: The Mexico City D.F. Mexico Temple Visitors’ Center is a beautiful building with adapted Mayan design and architecture.
Place.Address: Avenida 510 no. 90, Colonia San Juan de Aragón

Place.name: Monterrey Mexico Temple
Place.Snippet: 110th operating temple - Dedicated 28 April 2002 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 21 December 1995)
Place.Address: Avenida Eugenio Garza Sada, Esquina Privada Valle de la Estanzuela, Colonia Valle Alto

Place.name: Montevideo Uruguay Temple
Place.Snippet: 103rd operating temple - Dedicated 18 March 2001 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 2 November 1998)

Place.name: Monticello Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: 53rd operating temple - Dedicated 26–27 July 1998 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 4 October 1997); Rededicated 17 November 2002 by Gordon B. Hinckley

Place.name: Montreal Quebec Temple
Place.Snippet: 86th operating temple - Dedicated 4 June 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 6 August 1998); Rededicated 22 November 2015 by Henry B. Eyring

Place.name: Mormon Battalion Monument
Place.Snippet: The 100-foot granite and bronze monument honors the sacrifice made by the hundreds of Mormon pioneers who joined the U.S. Army during the Mexican War. Located on southeast lawn.

Place.name: Mormon Handcart
Place.Snippet: Experience a trek much like the one pioneers endured over 150 years ago.

Place.name: Mormon Pioneer Memorial Monument
Place.Snippet: Dedicated to the more than 6,000 souls who died making the journey to Utah from Illinois and other parts of the world between 1847 and 1869. It is also contains the gravesite of Brigham Young and other early Mormon leaders.

Place.name: Mormon Trail Center
Place.Snippet: Witness the great "Mormon Migration" as you walk beside a covered wagon, pull a handcart and climb in the bunks on a steam ship.

Place.name: Mount Pisgah
Place.Snippet: Established in southern Iowa as a temporary way station for Mormon emigrants who crossed the Plains from 1846-1852. The picturesque setting was a welcome sight to many of the expelled Saints.

Place.name: Mount Timpanogos Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: 49th operating temple - Dedicated 13–19 October 1996 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 3 October 1992)

Place.name: Nairobi Kenya Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 2, 2017 - Status: Planning and approval; awaiting official site announcement

Place.name: Nashville Tennessee Temple
Place.Snippet: 84th operating temple - Dedicated 21 May 2000 by James E. Faust (Announced 9 November 1994)

Place.name: Nauvoo Brickyard
Place.Snippet: The brickmaker will demonstrate how bricks were formed, dried and baked in Old Nauvoo. You may take home a souvenir Nauvoo brick.

Place.name: Nauvoo Cultural Hall
Place.Snippet: Also known as the Masonic Hall, this stately building was the scene not only of theatricals and meetings of the Masonic Lodge but also of court sessions and funerals.

Place.name: Nauvoo Family Living Center
Place.Snippet: Discover candle making, rope winding, spinning, and other early crafts. Get a taste of what it was like to live in early Nauvoo.

Place.name: Nauvoo Illinois Temple
Place.Snippet: 113th operating temple - Dedicated 27–30 June 2002 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 4 April 1999)

Place.name: Nauvoo Printing Office
Place.Snippet: Here you can see a period printing press and learn about the time-consuming labors necessary to print documents in the 1840s.

Place.name: Nauvoo Post Office
Place.Snippet: Part of a three-building complex that also includes the John Taylor home and the printing office. Eventually the post office was torn down and rebuilt.

Place.name: Nauvoo Visitors' Center
Place.Snippet: Explore historic Nauvoo by examining the 1846 relief map of Nauvoo, viewing an introductory video, and studying historic artifacts and displays.

Place.name: Newel K. and Elizabeth Ann Whitney Home
Place.Snippet: When Joseph and Emma Smith initially moved to Kirtland, they stayed at this home of these Saints for several weeks.

Place.name: Newel K. Whitney Store
Place.Snippet: General store, restored to its 1830 condition. Joseph Smith lived here for a time and established the School of the Prophets in one of the upper rooms.

Place.name: Newport Beach California Temple
Place.Snippet: 122nd operating temple - Dedicated 28 August 2005 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 21 April 2001)

Place.name: New Zealand Temple Visitors' Center
Place.Snippet: Beautiful Hamilton New Zealand Temple Visitors' Center, located next to the majestic Hamilton New Zealand Temple

Place.name: Nuku'alofa Tonga Temple
Place.Snippet: 23rd operating temple - Dedicated 9–11 August 1983 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 2 April 1980); Rededicated 4 November 2007 by Russell M. Nelson

Place.name: Oakland California Temple
Place.Snippet: 13th operating temple - Dedicated 17–19 November 1964 by David O. McKay (Announced 23 January 1961); CLOSED: Renovation commenced February 2018 - Status: both water feature fountains removed from grounds; interior renovations underway; Scaffolding up around main spire

Place.name: Oakland Temple Visitors' Center
Place.Snippet: Stroll around the beautifully manicured grounds and enjoy a stunning view of the Bay Area.

Place.name: Oaxaca Mexico Temple
Place.Snippet: 74th operating temple - Dedicated 11 March 2000 by James E. Faust (Announced 23 February 1999)
Place.Address: Avenida Universidad no. 139, Fraccionamiento Real de Candiani

Place.name: Ogden Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: 14th operating temple - Dedicated 18–20 January 1972 by Joseph Fielding Smith (Announced 24 August 1967); Rededicated 21 September 2014 by Thomas S. Monson

Place.name: Oklahoma City Oklahoma Temple
Place.Snippet: 95th operating temple - Dedicated 30 July 2000 by James E. Faust (Announced 14 March 1999); CLOSED: Renovation commenced in October 2017 - Status: Stone cladding underway

Place.name: Old Nauvoo Burial Grounds
Place.Snippet: A bronze monument of a grieving family stands sentinel over this sacred cemetery, a peaceful and wooded resting place for early pioneers.

Place.name: Oquirrh Mountain Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: 130th operating temple - Dedicated 21–23 August 2009 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 1 October 2005)

Place.name: Orlando Florida Temple
Place.Snippet: 46th operating temple - Dedicated 9–11 October 1994 by Howard W. Hunter (Announced 17 February 1990)

Place.name: Orson Hyde Memorial Garden
Place.Snippet: A 5.5 acre park dedicated in 1979 by President Kimball in memory of the prayer on 24 October 1841 where he dedicated the land of Palestine for the building up of Jerusalem and the gathering of Abraham’s posterity.

Place.name: Pocatello Idaho Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 2, 2017 - Status: Planning and approval; awaiting official site announcement

Place.name: Palmyra New York Temple
Place.Snippet: 77th operating temple - Dedicated 6 April 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 21 February 1999)

Place.name: Panama City Panama Temple
Place.Snippet: 127th operating temple - Dedicated 10 August 2008 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 23 August 2002)

Place.name: Papeete Tahiti Temple
Place.Snippet: 25th operating temple - Dedicated 27–29 October 1983 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 2 April 1980); Rededicated 12 November 2006 by L. Tom Perry

Place.name: Paris France Temple
Place.Snippet: 156th operating temple - Dedicated 21 May 2017 by Henry B. Eyring (Announced 15 July 2011)

Place.name: Paris Idaho Tabernacle
Place.Snippet: Built between 1884 and 1889 by pioneers in Bear Lake Valley who used horse and ox teams to haul rock quarried from Indian Creek Canyon nearly 18 miles away. It cost $50,000 to build and seats around 2000 people. Dedicated September 15, 1889 by President Wilford Woodruff.

Place.name: Parley P. Pratt Monument
Place.Snippet: In memory of the man who built a road from Big Kanyon into Salt Lake City. Ed Fraughton created the monument and statue depicting him with an open toolbox and surveying instruments.

Place.name: Payson Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: 146th operating temple - Dedicated 7 June 2015 by Henry B. Eyring (Announced 25 January 2010)

Place.name: Pendleton Nauvoo Log Home and School
Place.Snippet: Discover the interior of a log schoolroom and cabin. Imagine calculating math problems with a slate board and a piece of chalk!

Place.name: Perth Australia Temple
Place.Snippet: 106th operating temple - Dedicated 20 May 2001 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 11 June 1999)

Place.name: Peter Whitmer Log Home
Place.Snippet: The home where on April 6, 1830, The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints was formally organized.

Place.name: Philadelphia Pennsylvania Temple
Place.Snippet: 152nd operating temple - Dedicated 18 September 2016 by Henry B. Eyring (Announced 4 October 2008)

Place.name: Pipe Spring National Monument
Place.Snippet: In 1870 the church built a fort here to protect the mormon ranchers and the friendly Kaibab Pauite tribe. Visitors will see artifacts and furnishings from the 1800s and learn more about the history of the fort.

Place.name: Phoenix Arizona Temple
Place.Snippet: 144th operating temple - Dedicated 16 November 2014 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 24 May 2008)

Place.name: Polynesian Cultural Center
Place.Snippet: Within eight simulated tropical villages, performers demonstrate various arts and crafts from throughout Polynesia.

Place.name: Port-au-Prince Haiti Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 5, 2015 - Status: Groundbreaking held Saturday, October 28, 2017; Framing the interior walls; baptismal font poured

Place.name: Portland Oregon Temple
Place.Snippet: 42nd operating temple - Dedicated 19 August 1989 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 7 April 1984)

Place.name: Portland Temple Visitors’ Center
Place.Snippet: Enjoy the lush gardens on the Portland Temple grounds, then come inside the visitors' center to learn more about Jesus Christ and the purpose of temples.

Place.name: Porto Alegre Brazil Temple
Place.Snippet: 102nd operating temple - Dedicated 17 December 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 30 September 1997)
Place.Address: Rua General Salvador Pinheiro, 50, Vila Jardim
Place.CityState: Porto Alegre, Rio Grande do Sul

Place.name: Preston England Temple
Place.Snippet: 52nd operating temple - Dedicated 7–10 June 1998 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 19 October 1992)

Place.name: Priesthood Restoration Site Visitors’ Center
Place.Snippet: Here you can relax and enjoy artwork, artifacts, and hands-on activities. Watch a brief movie about the restoration of the priesthood before taking a tour of the historic homes and grounds.

Place.name: Provo City Center Temple
Place.Snippet: 150th operating temple - Dedicated 20 March 2016 by Dallin H. Oaks (Announced 1 October 2011)

Place.name: Provo Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: 15th operating temple - Dedicated 9 February 1972 by Joseph Fielding Smith read by Harold B. Lee (Announced 14 August 1967)

Place.name: Quetzaltenango Guatemala Temple
Place.Snippet: 136th operating temple - Dedicated 11 December 2011 by Dieter F. Uchtdorf (Announced 16 December 2006)
Place.Address: 9a Calle 4-03, Zona 9, Frente a Residenciales Los Cerezos 1

Place.name: Quito, Ecuador Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 3, 2016 - Status: Planning and approval; awaiting official site announcement

Place.name: Raleigh North Carolina Temple
Place.Snippet: 68th operating temple - Dedicated 18–19 December 1999 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 3 September 1998); CLOSED: Renovation commenced in January 2018 - Status: Stone cladding has begun; Drywall is being hung in the interior

Place.name: Recife Brazil Temple
Place.Snippet: 101st operating temple - Dedicated 15 December 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 13 January 1995)
Place.Address: Rua Dr. José de Góes, 284, Parnamirim

Place.name: Red Brick Store
Place.Snippet: Originally built in 1841, this became headquarters for the Church shortly after its completion. The upstairs room was the place of many significant events including the organization of the Relief Society.

Place.name: Redlands California Temple
Place.Snippet: 116th operating temple - Dedicated 14 September 2003 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 21 April 2001)

Place.name: Regina Saskatchewan Temple
Place.Snippet: 65th operating temple - Dedicated 14 November 1999 by Boyd K. Packer (Announced 3 August 1998)

Place.name: Relief Society Building
Place.Snippet: World headquarters for Primary, Young Women, and Relief Society. Women of the Church from around the world donated funds to construct the building, which was completed in 1956.

Place.name: Reno Nevada Temple
Place.Snippet: 81st operating temple - Dedicated 23 April 2000 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 12 April 1999)

Place.name: Rexburg Idaho Temple
Place.Snippet: 125th operating temple - Dedicated 10 February 2008 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 12 December 2003)

Place.name: Richmond Pioneer Cemetery
Place.Snippet: The Three Witnesses Monument was dedicated in 1911 by Elder Heber J. Grant. A metal casket within a concrete base was placed under it which contain significant church books and engraved portraits.

Place.name: Richmond Virginia Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 1, 2018 - Status: Planning and approval; awaiting official site announcement

Place.name: Rio de Janeiro Brazil Temple
Place.Snippet: Scheduled Dedication: mid 2019 (Announced 6 April 2013) - Status: Stone cladding of the exterior underway
Place.Address: Avenida das Américas, 8400, Barra da Tijuca
Place.CityState: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro

Place.name: Riser Nauvoo Home and Boot Shop
Place.Snippet: Learn how an 1840s shoemaker used different grades of leather and wood to construct shoes. Also learn how pioneers “personalized” their shoes.

Place.name: Rock Creek Hollow
Place.Snippet: The Willie handcart company arrived here after a grueling hike over Rocky Ridge. This area now features a memorial honoring their faith and sacrifice.

Place.name: Rome Italy Temple
Place.Snippet: Scheduled Dedication: March 10–17, 2019 (Announced 4 October 2008) - Status: Installation of the exterior lighting system completed; Sod laid for a beautiful lawn surrounding the temple.

Place.name: Russia Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 1, 2018 - Status: Planning and approval; awaiting official site announcement

Place.name: Sacramento California Temple
Place.Snippet: 123rd operating temple - Dedicated 3 September 2006 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 21 April 2001)

Place.name: Sacred Grove
Place.Snippet: Almost two centuries after the First Vision, the grove still retains much of its ancient beauty. The Church maintains it as a quiet place of contemplation.

Place.name: St. George Tabernacle
Place.Snippet: Dedicated in 1876 after more than a decade under construction, it is known as the "Jewel of the West". Best known for the place where President Lorenzo Snow received a revelation that the Saints needed to be more faithful in paying their tithes and offerings.

Place.name: St. George Utah FamilySearch Center
Place.Snippet: Opened in June 2017, this remarkable state-of-the-art facility is designed to personalize the family history experience for all ages.

Place.name: St. George Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: 1st operating temple - Dedicated 6–8 April 1877 by Daniel H. Wells with Brigham Young presiding (Announced 9 November 1871); Rededicated 11–12 November 1975 by Spencer W. Kimball

Place.name: St. George Utah Temple Visitors' Center
Place.Snippet: Stroll through the beautiful temple grounds and gaze at the striking St. George Utah Temple, the first temple built in Utah.

Place.name: St. Louis Missouri Temple
Place.Snippet: 50th operating temple - Dedicated 1–5 June 1997 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 29 December 1990)

Place.name: St. Paul Minnesota Temple
Place.Snippet: 69th operating temple - Dedicated 9 January 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 29 July 1998)

Place.name: Salta Argentina Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 1, 2018 - Status: Planning and approval; awaiting official site announcement

Place.name: Sarah Granger Kimball Nauvoo Home
Place.Snippet: The home of a woman who played a vital role in establishing the Female Relief Society of Nauvoo.

Place.name: Saratoga Springs Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced April 2, 2017 - Status: Planning and approval; awaiting official site announcement; Tentative plans and location submitted to city.

Place.name: Salt Lake City Cemetery
Place.Snippet: Some of the most prominent figures from Latter-day Saint history and leadership are buried here. The grave sites of 11 Church Presidents can be easily located using maps available at the cemetery office.

Place.name: Salt Lake City Tabernacle
Place.Snippet: Dome-shaped auditorium with near-perfect acoustics. Home of the Mormon Tabernacle Choir and a magnificent pipe organ with 11,623 pipes.

Place.name: Salt Lake Temple
Place.Snippet: 4th operating temple - Dedicated 6–24 April 1893 by Wilford Woodruff (Announced 28 July 1847)

Place.name: Saluda Memorial
Place.Snippet: This memorial of the steamboat tragedy was presented to the city of Lexington, Missouri in 2002. 28 Latter-day Saint emigrants traveling towards the Salt Lake Valley were among the many killed.

Place.name: San Antonio Texas Temple
Place.Snippet: 120th operating temple - Dedicated 22 May 2005 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 24 June 2001)

Place.name: San Diego California Temple
Place.Snippet: 45th operating temple - Dedicated 25–30 April 1993 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 7 April 1984)

Place.name: San Diego Mormon Battalion
Place.Snippet: Learn why this group of Latter-day Saint men and women joined the U.S. Army and what they accomplished during and after their march.

Place.name: San José Costa Rica Temple
Place.Snippet: 87th operating temple - Dedicated 4 June 2000 by James E. Faust (Announced 17 March 1999)

Place.name: San Salvador El Salvador Temple
Place.Snippet: 135th operating temple - Dedicated 21 August 2011 by Henry B. Eyring (Announced 7 November 2007)
Place.Address: Colonia San Benito, Avenida El Espino, entre Calle El Pedregal y Boulevard Diego de Holguín

Place.name: Santiago Chile Temple
Place.Snippet: 24th operating temple - Dedicated 15–17 September 1983 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 2 April 1980); Rededicated 12 March 2006 by Gordon B. Hinckley

Place.name: Santo Domingo Dominican Republic Temple
Place.Snippet: 99th operating temple - Dedicated 17 September 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 16 November 1993)

Place.name: São Paulo Brazil Temple
Place.Snippet: 17th operating temple - Dedicated 30 October–2 November 1978 by Spencer W. Kimball (Announced 1 March 1975); Rededicated 22 February 2004 by Gordon B. Hinckley

Place.name: Sapporo Japan Temple
Place.Snippet: 151st operating temple - Dedicated 21 August 2016 by Russell M. Nelson (Announced 3 October 2009)

Place.name: Scovil Bakery
Place.Snippet: Experience a baker's life before the days of electric and gas ovens. See the baking equipment of the 1840s, including a bustle oven, an open hearth, and a spider pan.

Place.name: Seattle Family Discovery Center
Place.Snippet: Opened in August 2015, this remarkable state-of-the-art facility is designed to personalize the family history experience for all ages. Located inside the church meetinghouse near the temple.

Place.name: Seattle Washington Temple
Place.Snippet: 19th operating temple - Dedicated 17–21 November 1980 by Spencer W. Kimball (Announced 15 November 1975)

Place.name: Seoul Korea Temple
Place.Snippet: 37th operating temple - Dedicated 14–15 December 1985 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 1 April 1981)

Place.name: Seventies Hall
Place.Snippet: First MTC and library, where men and women once gathered to listen to Brigham Young and other Church leaders. The building now houses a museum of household artifacts.

Place.name: Sixth Crossing
Place.Snippet: This new Visitors' Center was dedicated June 15, 2017 as a tribute to the pioneers of the ill-fated Willie and Martin handcart companies. Experience a trek on the Sweetwater trail.

Place.name: Smith Family Farm
Place.Snippet: Here in the family’s small log home the Angel Moroni appeared to Joseph and revealed the existence of the Book of Mormon.

Place.name: Smith Family Homestead
Place.Snippet: This cabin on the river became Joseph and Emma's first home in Nauvoo. Smith Family Cemetery is located here as well.

Place.name: Smith Family Memorial
Place.Snippet: This monument in Topsfield, Massachusetts, was erected in 1873 by George A. Smith in honor of several of Joseph Smith Jr.'s ancestors.

Place.name: Snowflake Arizona Temple
Place.Snippet: 108th operating temple - Dedicated 3 March 2002 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 2 April 2000)

Place.name: Spokane Washington Temple
Place.Snippet: 59th operating temple - Dedicated 21–23 August 1999 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 13 August 1998)

Place.name: Star Valley Wyoming Temple
Place.Snippet: 154th operating temple - Dedicated 30 October 2016 by David A. Bednar (Announced 1 October 2011)

Place.name: Stannard Quarry
Place.Snippet: Early members of The Church obtained stone from here for the Kirtland Temple. Marks from their work are still visible today.

Place.name: Stockholm Sweden Temple
Place.Snippet: 34th operating temple - Dedicated 2–4 July 1985 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 1 April 1981)

Place.name: Stoddard Nauvoo Home and Tin Shop
Place.Snippet: A restored 1840s tinshop, complete with tools and a demonstration of tinsmith techniques.

Place.name: Susquehanna River
Place.Snippet: On the bank of this now quiet river, visitors can contemplate the first baptisms in this dispensation.

Place.name: Suva Fiji Temple
Place.Snippet: 91st operating temple - Dedicated 18 June 2000 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 7 May 1998); Rededicated 21 February 2016 by Henry B. Eyring

Place.name: Sydney Australia Temple
Place.Snippet: 28th operating temple - Dedicated 20–23 September 1984 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 2 April 1980)
Place.Address: 756 Pennant Hills Road, (Corner of Pennant Hills Road and Moseley Street)

Place.name: Taipei Taiwan Temple
Place.Snippet: 31st operating temple - Dedicated 17–18 November 1984 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 31 March 1982)

Place.name: Tampico Mexico Temple
Place.Snippet: 83rd operating temple - Dedicated 20 May 2000 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 8 July 1998)
Place.Address: Avenida Ejército Mexicano no. 74 con 3A Avenida, Colonia Lomas del Gallo

Place.name: Temple Square
Place.Snippet: As Utah’s most visited attraction, it is 35 acres of enchantment in the heart of Salt Lake City.

Place.name: Temple Square North Visitors' Center
Place.Snippet: Stand beneath the Milky Way painted dome in the rotunda and ponder the invitation of the outstretched arms of Thorvaldsen’s Christus. Continue on to the 14-square-foot replica map of first century Jerusalem.

Place.name: Temple Square South Visitors' Center
Place.Snippet: Interact with a scale model of the Salt Lake Temple and view the intricate details of each room. Uncover why the temple took 40 years to build and why temples are so important to eternal families.

Place.name: Tegucigalpa Honduras Temple
Place.Snippet: 141st operating temple - Dedicated 17 March 2013 by Dieter F. Uchtdorf (Announced 9 June 2006)
Place.Address: Residenciales Roble Oeste, Boulevard Roble Oeste, 3ra Calle Sur

Place.name: The Gila Valley Arizona Temple
Place.Snippet: 132nd operating temple - Dedicated 23 May 2010 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 26 April 2008)

Place.name: The Hague Netherlands Temple
Place.Snippet: 114th operating temple - Dedicated 8 September 2002 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 16 August 1999)

Place.name: This Is the Place Monument
Place.Snippet: This granite structure near the mouth of Emigration Canyon was unveiled in 1947 to commemorate the centennial anniversary of the arrival of the Mormon pioneers into the Salt Lake Valley.

Place.name: Tijuana Mexico Temple
Place.Snippet: 149th operating temple - Dedicated 13 December 2015 by Dieter F. Uchtdorf (Announced 2 October 2010)
Place.Address: Paseo Del Rio #6832, Fraccionamiento Rio Tijuana 3a Etapa Delegación La Meza

Place.name: Tokyo Japan Temple
Place.Snippet: 18th operating temple - Dedicated 27–29 October 1980 by Spencer W. Kimball (Announced 9 August 1975); CLOSED: Renovation commenced in October 2017 - Status: interior renovations underway; annex building and surface parking removed

Place.name: Toronto Ontario Temple
Place.Snippet: 44th operating temple - Dedicated 25–27 August 1990 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 7 April 1984)

Place.name: Trujillo Peru Temple
Place.Snippet: 147th operating temple - Dedicated 21 June 2015 by Dieter F. Uchtdorf (Announced 13 December 2008)

Place.name: Tucson Arizona Temple
Place.Snippet: 157th operating temple - Dedicated 13 August 2017 by Dieter F. Uchtdorf (Announced 6 October 2012)

Place.name: Tuxtla Gutiérrez Mexico Temple
Place.Snippet: 75th operating temple - Dedicated 12 March 2000 by James E. Faust (Announced 25 February 1999)
Place.Address: Carretera a Chicoasen Chiapas Kilómetro 1,4, Esquina Paseo de la Roseta, Fraccionamiento San José Chapultepec

Place.name: Twin Falls Idaho Temple
Place.Snippet: 128th operating temple - Dedicated 24 August 2008 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 2 October 2004)

Place.name: Urdaneta Philippines Temple
Place.Snippet: Announced October 2, 2010 - Status: Awaiting government approvals; Elder Ronald A. Rasband visited this temple site during a recent countrywide tour.

Place.name: Vancouver British Columbia Temple
Place.Snippet: 131st operating temple - Dedicated 2 May 2010 by Thomas S. Monso (Announced 25 May 2006)

Place.name: Veracruz Mexico Temple
Place.Snippet: 93rd operating temple - Dedicated 9 July 2000 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 14 April 1999)
Place.Address: Avenida Ejército Mexicano, Esquina Michoacán, Colonia Luís Echeverría

Place.name: Vernal Utah Temple
Place.Snippet: 51st operating temple - Dedicated 2–4 November 1997 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 13 February 1994)

Place.name: Villahermosa Mexico Temple
Place.Snippet: 85th operating temple - Dedicated 21 May 2000 by Thomas S. Monson (Announced 30 October 1998)
Place.Address: Avenida 27 de Febrero no. 1717, Colonia Atasta de Serra

Place.name: Washington D.C. Temple
Place.Snippet: 16th operating temple - Dedicated 19–22 November 1974 by Spencer W. Kimball (Announced 15 November 1968); CLOSED: Renovation commenced March 2018

Place.name: Washington D.C. Temple Visitors' Center
Place.Snippet: Visit this peaceful site on a 52-acre hilltop with woods, specimen trees, and beautiful flower gardens.

Place.name: Webb Brothers Blacksmith Shop
Place.Snippet: Learn how wagon wheels were constructed. Everyone who visits receives a “prairie diamond” ring.

Place.name: Welfare Square
Place.Snippet: A tour of this place serves as both a history lesson and a reminder of the Church’s mission to "care for the poor, foster self-reliance, and provide meaningful opportunities for work and service."

Place.name: Wilford Woodruff Nauvoo Home
Place.Snippet: One of the finest and best-preserved brick houses of the 1840s—one of the few homes in Historic Nauvoo furnished with the original inhabitants’ belongings.

Place.name: Winnipeg Manitoba Temple
Place.Snippet: Scheduled Dedication: TBD (Announced 2 April 2011) - Status: Construction has begun - Construction underway on temple complex. The first building under construction is the meetinghouse.

Place.name: Winter Quarters Nebraska Temple
Place.Snippet: 104th operating temple - Dedicated 22 April 2001 by Gordon B. Hinckley (Announced 14 June 1999)
